title: Talking About a Past Holiday (Simple Past)

content.text: In this lesson, you'll learn to talk about a past holiday. We'll use the simple past tense of the verb 'zijn' (to be): 'ik was' (I was) and 'wij waren' (we were).

data.tip: The stress is on the second syllable: 'va-KAN-tie'.

content.title: Where you went
content.setting: You see your colleague, Eva, for the first time after your holiday.

conversation_flow.title: Say where you went on holiday
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Hoi! Hoe was je vakantie? Waar was je?

conversation_flow.title: Mention who you went with
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Leuk! Met wie was je daar?

conversation_flow.title: State how long you were there
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Gezellig. En hoe lang waren jullie daar?

content.text: Good job! For actions in the past, we often use 'hebben' + a past participle. For example, 'wij hebben gezwommen' (we swam).

data.tip: The 'g' at the beginning is a soft, throaty sound, typical in Dutch.

content.title: Describing the holiday
content.setting: Eva wants to know more details about your holiday.

conversation_flow.title: Describe the weather
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Klinkt goed! En hoe was het weer?

conversation_flow.title: Describe the food
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Dat is relaxed. En het eten, was dat lekker?

content.text: When an adjective comes before a noun, it usually gets an '-e' at the end. For example: 'het was een fantastische vakantie'.

data.meaning: I would like to go back

data.tip: The 'g' sound is made at the back of your throat. It's similar to the 'ch' in the Scottish word 'loch'.

content.title: Giving your opinion
content.setting: You're wrapping up the conversation about your holiday.

conversation_flow.title: Give your overall opinion
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Super! Dus, het was een goede vakantie?

conversation_flow.title: Say you want to go back
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Dat is fijn om te horen.
